pullRequest.body:
Add five lemmas about coercions between Hahn or Laurent Series and Rational Functions

Co-authored-by: María Inés de Frutos Fernández @mariainesdff 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
> General remark, not for this PR: should we split this file? It's getting quite long and diverse...

I fully agree and have addressed this point in my final comment about moving some results to the Hahn series file.

Splitting the file seems a good idea, thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8777611487/job/24082805374)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8777611487/job/24082805481)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8777611487/job/24082805708)
Looks good, one small convention question.

Thanks for your changes, it's looking good to me. I think since you've addressed all the reviewers' remarks you should be ready to merge this, but I'll give them some time before I hit merge for the final complaints.
Looks good, one small convention question.
General remark, not for this PR: should we split this file? It's getting quite long and diverse...

Thanks for your changes, it's looking good to me. I think since you've addressed all the reviewers' remarks you should be ready to merge this, but I'll give them some time before I hit merge for the final complaints.

In two of these three theorems, `single_pow` and `single_zpow`, the left side is an expression `single a b`, and the right side has other functions applied. In `single_inv`, this convention is reversed.
Should there be a convention, possibly even for `simp`, where the expression of the form `single a b` is either consistently the LHS or consistently the RHS?
Good point. I do not know about other parts of the library, but at least I have aligned them here.
I agree with the direction that you have aligned them to. Basically, we should see `single` as a homomorphism and try to make its arguments smaller.

Although the name should be changed to reflect the new left hand side. Maybe:
```suggestion
theorem single_one_eq_pow {R : Type _} [Ring R] (n : ℕ) :
```
or
```suggestion
theorem single_one {R : Type _} [Ring R] (n : ℕ) :
```
?
Taken the first one.
Is this comment useful?
No! Good catch, thanks.
Why adding the `by`?
Old tentive thats stayed there, thanks for the catch.
Is there a reason `f \neq 0` is not a variable?
Basically that I never remember what is prefered. I have changed it (is it better?)

```suggestion
theorem single_inv (d : ℤ) {α : F} (hα : α ≠ 0) :
```

Could you define a separate function? That's required for the `@[coe]` annotation which we need for certain tactics. Something like (untested):
```suggestion
@[coe]
def coePolynomial (P : Polynomial K) : RatFunc K := algebraMap _ _ P

instance : Coe (Polynomial K) (RatFunc K) := ⟨coePolynomial⟩
```
Done (and it worked)

A proof without `erw`/`rfl` so better resistant against library changes:
```suggestion
  simp [RatFunc.coe_def]
```
If you're speaking about the proof of `coe_coe`, the nice `simp [RatFunc.coe_def]` proof does not work for me...
Hm, it worked for me... Maybe you also need to unfold the new `coePolynomial` definition in `simp`?
Yep! Good catch.
All of these are only about `HahnSeries`, right? Could you move them to an appropriate file in `RingTheory/HahnSeries`?

I would be happy to do so, but I think this is somewhat connected to your comment about splitting the file (which I agree with). My main question comes from the fact that Laurent series are defined as an abbreviation of Hahn Series for the monoid Z and so I tend to consider that everything pertaining to Laurent series actually has to do to Hahn ones. Would it be possible to 
1. Merge this PR as it is (modulo other remarks about proofs/naming/etc)
2. We discuss the rationale beyond splitting this and possibly other files touching Laurent series
3. I open a new PR where I split the file?
Okay, sounds good to me!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (Mathlib/FieldTheory/RatFunc.lean): add five lemmas about coercions between Hahn or Laurent Series and Rational Functions
